column1: Data Supplied By: National Livestock Reporting Service
Data source: National Livestock Reporting Service
Please see terms of use here: https://www.mla.com.au/general/Terms-and-conditions/data-and-information/

Numbers were down for a total yarding of 1032 mixed quality weaner calves. Steer calves dominated the numbers with extra heavy weights easing while the lighter weights held firm to 5c up. Extra heavy weight heifer calves gained again with demand .The heavy weights were firm and medium weights gained on quality while light weight heifers eased 5c/kg.

Weaner steers weighing over 380kg sold from 280c to 338c while weights from 330 to 380kg made 280c to 348c and lighter weights under 330kg returned 278c to 344c quality dependent.

Weaner heifers weighing over 380kg reached 280c to 286c while weights from 330kg to 380kg sold from 250c to 282c /kg. Lighter weight calves under 330kg made from 140c to 278c /kg.

Tracey Kilner--NLRS
